entry.title: [ChromeRefresh2023] Add variations of the new tab button.
entry.content:
This CL adds 5 different versions of the new tab button which are

choosable via the chrome flags UI.



GM2Full: for the original GM2 implementationm

and 4 for the CR23 implementation

GM3OldIconNoBackground: M114 Icon without a background

GM3OldIconWithBackground: M114 Icon with a background

GM3NewIconWithoutBackground: M117 Icon without a background

GM3NewIconWithBackground: M117 Icon with a background



All variations work with both the CR23 flag being turned off and being turned on.



The defaults stay the same as 117+ Chromium, with CR23 flag off GM2Full is the default. With GM3 on GM3NewIconWithoutBackground is the default.



In this CL a bug was also fixed where the width of the label button was being used to calculate rounded edges before layout had occured causing a width of 0 and code was renamed/cleaned up (see TabStripControlButton)



Bug: 1494411

Change-Id: Ib6966053fd6ca440bce5504784b9f94fde1a7db4

entry.title: Call GetPrefetchToServe() before checking metrics in tests
entry.content:
An upcoming CL [1] will move the

`PrefetchServingPageMetrics` recording from

`Navigate()` (i.e. `PrefetchDocumentManager::DidStartNavigation()`)

to `GetPrefetchToServe()`.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4953503



Therefore, this CL reorders the calls in PrefetchService

unit tests in the order of:



1. `Navigate()`

2. `GetPrefetchToServe()`

3. `ExpectServingMetrics()`



so that the serving metrics can be observed

no matter whether before or after the CL [1].



Bug: 1448731

Change-Id: I25da291459b65af8570ba2b435f55d32b1b44d3f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4954079

entry.title: [omnibox] Add logic/feature params for company entity adjustment.
entry.content:
This CL adds necessary feature params for the company entity

icon adjustment groups. It also adds the implementation that

replaces a company entity's image for a search loupe.

The 3 cases where this occurs is:

1) Matching historical URL suggestion is in the first row and the

matching company search suggestion is in the second row.

2) Matching historical URL suggestion is in the first row and the

matching company search suggestion is in any row.

3) Matching historical URL suggestion is in any row and the

matching company search suggestion is in any row.

entry.title: Add a disconnect handler and reorder mojo-related variables
entry.content:
Add a disconnect handler to `receivers_` to ensure that a callback

gets removed first when a receiver gets disconnected or destroyed.

Create `pending_download_callback_map_` to maintain receivers and

their associated callbacks.

Also, place `pending_download_callback_map_` before `receivers_` so

that `pending_download_callback_map_` will be destroyed after

`receivers_`. This reordering provides an extra guarantee that the

callbacks get destroyed after their corresponding receivers.



AX-Relnotes: n/a.

Bug: b/305056689

Change-Id: I1c68dc3ad3f6d760931e28b6aa28c062131dbd7f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4937723

Reviewed-by: David Tseng

Reviewed-by: Yuzhu Shen

entry.title: snap-group: Add `SplitViewOverviewSession` exit point metrics
entry.content:
This cl adds two uma metrics for the `SplitViewOverviewSession`

exit points:

1. Ash.SplitViewOverviewSession.WindowLayoutCompleteOnSessionExit;

2. Ash.SplitViewOverviewSession.SplitViewOverviewSessionExitPoint.



Metic #1 focuses on the user-initiated action in partial overview

i.e. activate a window to complete the layout or skip the pairing.

This metric will give us quick and direct access to the key success

metric of `kFasterSplitScreenSetup`.



Metric #2 provides a breakdown of the user action to trigger the

exit of split overview session, which can be user-initiated or other

reasons such as system shutdown.



This cl also fixes an inaccurate enum recorded in `OverviewEndAction`

by adding an entry of `kWindowDeactivating`.



This cl will be combiend with crrev.com/c/4953989 to complete the

entire key user metrics for the ``kFasterSplitScreenSetup` dogfood.



Fixed: b/297096670

Test: Added unit test + run existing

Change-Id: Ibc4042ffa4d15262b8bb36d0a687d637ed01b3c5

entry.title: [Extensions] Add a new scripts_internal API
entry.content:
Note: forked from emiliapaz's work on

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4932785.



This CL introduces a new `scripts_internal` API type that defines a

structure, scripts_internal::SerializedUserScript, that can be used

to represent serialized user scripts from different types. This wires

up the ExtensionUserScriptLoader to use this new type instead of

api::content_scripts::ContentScript.



Now, when loading scripts from the StateStore, we will convert them

into the new SerializedUserScript type before converting them into

UserScript objects. When writing values to the StateStore, we store

them as SerializedUserScripts. This new type allows us to avoid the

hack we have in place for storing `id` on the serialized script

value and enables us to add more functionality unique to certain

script types in the future.



Other notable changes:

* We now check the ID for validity. Previously, we only checked it

for its presence, which meant we could crash if we found an invalid

ID and have undefined behavior if the ID corresponded to a type we

didn't expect (like a static content script in the dynamic script

store).

* Because this will require a full migration of the state store entries,

this removes the (incorrect) UMA logging for ID updates. A follow-up

will add UMA logging for the conversion to the new type.



This also adds a test for going from the old structure to the new

structure, ensuring scripts are properly loaded and preserved.



This CL should have no developer or user perceptable change.



Followup CLs will use this new serializable type in more areas,

allowing us to reduce duplicate code between the three sites of script

parsing.



Bug: 1494155

Change-Id: I7d68b31af8c9936bcaf5940efe87f413050bec85

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4956682

entry.title: Implemented proper handling of column visibility in Task Manager
entry.content:
If you hide the last column in Task Manager, it does not get hidden,

but the visibility of this column is store to the local state.

This causes the next opening of Task Manager to display a different

column instead. Therefore, it is necessary to check the return value

of SetColumnVisibility(). Only when the visibility of the column

changes should it be recorded.

entry.title: Replace WebContents::SetIgnoreInputEvents
entry.content:
Currently, `WebContents::SetIgnoreInputEvents` takes a boolean that

directly enables / disables input events. This is problematic for

cases in which multiple requests to ignore input exist at once.



This change replaces it with `IgnoreInputEvents()`, which returns a

ScopedClosureRunner. Input events are blocked until all outstanding

closures have been run. As a bonus, this also prevents leaving the

WebContents in a blocked state unintentionally.



Bug: 1480496, 1472386

Change-Id: Ia49163764518764f1ed69b947f3ec9dde9d0e642

Low-Coverage-Reason: TRIVIAL_CHANGE This CL changes a WebContents interface and updates consumers. Looked into adding additional tests to input_handler.cc rather than adding Low-Coverage, but it's not clear to me that it has any tests.

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4950728

entry.title: Reland "Move local storage module out of CrOS Chrome"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 724183ea31566a5cb8d2f99f9403858dfb70509b.



Reason for revert: The original issue is not fixed, but this revert caused build breaks on all bots:



https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4961134



There might have been a hidden dependency between CLs.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Move local storage module out of CrOS Chrome"

>

> This reverts commit a1b8371c3c2bb421860d33c8b01d9d43db2fa144.

>

> Reason for revert: ReportClientTestSuite* tests are failing:

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests%20%28dbg%29%281%29

>

> First build with failure:

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests%20(dbg)(1)/116519/blamelist

>

>

> Original change's description:

> > Move local storage module out of CrOS Chrome

> >

> > Local storage is removed completely from ChromeOS Chrome

> > (both Ash and LaCros): text section size decreases by 2.3MiB.

> >

> > % size out_betty-pi-arc/Release/chrome out_betty-pi-arc/Release/chrome.old

> > text filename

> > 223208034 out_betty-pi-arc/Release/chrome

> > 225561033 out_betty-pi-arc/Release/chrome.old

> >

> > Size of the executable file decrease by 2.7MiB.

> >

> > 434473144 out_betty-pi-arc/Release/chrome

> > 437140432 out_betty-pi-arc/Release/chrome.old

> >

> > Note: in order to make inclusion of the Storage configuration-dependent,

> > we need to declare a new component; I made it of StorageSelector, and

> > since it refers to `messaging_layer`, it cannot remain in `components`.

> > So I moved it into `messaging_later` itself.

> >

> > Tests that involve enqueue+upload are removed from

> > `report_client_unittest.cc`. Also removed test for disabled uploader,

> > since this feature no longer exists.

> >

> > Tested manually on ChromeOS and Linux - events are uploaded just fine.

> >

> > Bug: b/206974617

> > Change-Id: I2b38ffc35c64126f887f7f66a6901123430cb107

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4950715

entry.title: Reland "crosier: Port login.Chrome and login.ChromeGaia"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 4ca35db8e2c6434031f006e6d6b90e9ee983a775



The reland fixes compile error for lacros device build by making

`chromeos_integration_login_mixin.cc.*` to ash-chrome only.



Original change's description:

> crosier: Port login.Chrome and login.ChromeGaia

>

> - Add `ChromeOSIntegrationLoginMixIn` that provides login support

> - It provides 3 login modes:

> - kStubLogin: Login like browser tests, Good for tests only need to

> verify chrome states.

> - kTestLogin: Login using oobe test api, same as tast's default

> login. Good for test that needs to simulate real login but do

> not need Gaia ideneity;

> - kGaiaLogin: Login using Gaia like production chrome.

> - Implement login integration tests that exercise kTestLogin

> (login.Chrome) and kGaiaLogin (login.ChromeGaia).

>

entry.title: Don't disable the field trial testing config with forced trials.
entry.content:
This fixes an issue where any browser test or interactive ui

test that was using a ScopedFeatureList with params would

disable the testing config entirely, due to the scoped override

state being converted to a --force-fieldtrials= command line

flag by BrowserTestBase::SetUp().



With the change, the flag will not preempt the testing config,

however any testing config entries that conflict with the

command-line will be skipped by the existing logic in

field_trial_util.cc's ShouldSkipExperiment().



Tests that were relying on running without the testing config

(i.e. failed with it) have been updated to explicitly pass

--disable-field-trial-config in separate CLs that have been

landed.

Exception: One PendingBeaconBackgroundTimeoutBrowserTest was

still failing which was not fixed up by a separate CL and is

being updated as part of this CL.



This CL also changes the bisect_variations.py script and the

command line produced by chrome://version/?show-variations-cmd

to specify --disable-field-trial-config as these are meant to

apply the state exactly as specified.



This CL will only land when trybots are green (once all dependent

CLs land).



Bug: 1491463

entry.title: Omnibox Carousel: Guarantee one tile is always 50% exposed on Phones.
entry.content:
This change replaces "NTP-compatible" algorithm with one that is

properly tailored for the Omnibox Carousel (and content).



The algorithm computes the exact amount of space needed to present

exactly #.5 tiles, given the carousel size, item size and initial

padding, ensuring that the minimum padding is always honored.



Results are captured in the following document:

http://docs/document/d/1qNJUSBrKjwp0nxFK5ByhAG1H40rW3msBhvt9DuLMpo4?resourcekey=0-BUCVTiezO3QY_sHb2sd3gw

entry.title: Fix AcrossTasksDangling raw_ptr in NavigationUrlLoaderImpl
entry.content:
NavigationUrlLoaderImpl stores a raw_ptr to

a ServiceWorkerMainResourceHandle. However, NavigationRequest destroys

the ServiceWorkerMainResourceHandle before destroying the

NavigationUrlLoaderImpl, causing the raw_ptr to become dangling.



This CL fixes the destruction order by changing the declaration order

in NavigationRequest, to ensure that the ServiceWorkerMainResourceHandle

is declared before (and hence destroyed after) the

NavigationUrlLoaderImpl.



This is part of a code health cleanup described in

https://docs.google.com/document/d/13o8YQRn_R10mabPDFahOLWkc3iT9NJYSk1BZSx8qOKE/

interpolations will be added in follow-up CLs.

entry.title: [Reauth] Move DeviceAuthenticatorCommon to components/
entry.content:
This is a no-op change.



Context:



DeviceAuthenticator on Desktop and Android relies on the

DeviceAuthenticatorProxy during creation, and this proxy is a one-per-

profile class owned by the factory. The regular DeviceAuthenticator then

is created based on the proxy and it is returned as a unique_ptr in the

AutofillClient.



On Bling, the last_successful_auth_timestamp can be recorded in the

native ReauthenticationModule, but since we don't want to update the

AutofillClient interface, we might as well follow the same pattern.

So this DeviceAuthenticatorProxy(/Common) should be shared by iOS too.

Move such classes to components to enable it.

> FormControlType but lumps together and

histograms to track the overall performance of the AccessibilityState.

useful data going forward about timing of the AccessibilityState code.

entry.title: [shared storage] Move the implementation of sharedStorage.selectURL()/run() to the SharedStorageWorklet class
entry.content:
This prepares for a potential future change to actually expose

selectURL()/run() on the sharedStorage.worklet JS object.



A non-web-visible behavior difference: when selectURL()/run() is called

without addModule(), we still construct `shared_storage_worklet_`, even

though we could fail it early. This is because we prefer a cleaner code

over saving the overhead of constructing `shared_storage_worklet_`.

entry.title: [User Education] Fix potential null callback crash
entry.content:
We were being too cute about setting the timeout callback before, and

not checking for null as a result. Ideally, there should not be cases

where we try to call a null callback, but since it's not possible to

determine which corner case is causing the crash in the attached bug, it

makes sense to just be less cute and check for null.

entry.title: [Layout Manager] Allow manual setting of view visibility
entry.content:
For views which want to mix manual layout steps with a layout manager,

allows for the hiding or showing of specific views without invalidating

the view hierarchy resulting in a layout loop.



ManualLayoutUtil provides the ability to hide or show (subject to layout

constraints) a view before a layout manager is applied. It should only

be used inside of an overridden View::Layout() method, before the base

class layout method is called.



Change-Id: Ief154572f0b7446a890a33fef09cbba08113435e

entry.title: usb: Validate isochronous transfer packet lengths
entry.content:
USBDevice.isochronousTransferIn and

USBDevice.isochronousTransferOut take a parameter containing

a list of packet lengths. This CL adds validation that the

total packet length does not exceed the maximum buffer size.

For isochronousTransferOut, it also checks that the total

length of all packets in bytes is equal to the size of the

data buffer.



Passing invalid packet lengths causes the promise to be

rejected with a DataError.



Bug: 1492381, 1492384

entry.title: Pre-paint: Walk a missed child correctly.
entry.content:
If it would have been walked via a simple LayoutObject tree traversal,

do that in WalkMissedChildren() as well. Don't assume that it will

always be a NGPhysicalBoxFragment-accompanied walk. That only happens

inside a block fragmentation context, and we might not be inside of one.



This was tricky to reproduce, and I suspect that there are bugs in the

LayoutObject hierarchy flag marking machinery somewhere, or this

wouldn't have happened at all.



Explanation of what went wrong in the test:



During the second pre-paint walk (after changing touch-action), normal

pre-paint skips the IFRAME because its parent DIV returns early in

PrePaintTreeWalk::Walk(). Since the IFRAME is fixed-positioned, it will

be added to the list of missable children of LayoutView. And since it's

skipped, it's seen as missed. And we end up in PrePaintTreeWalk::

WalkMissedChildren(). And Walk()ing this child, will not return early,

because ObjectRequiresPrePaint() returns true, because

object.DescendantEffectiveAllowedTouchActionChanged() is true. It is

true because LocalFrameView::RunPrePaintLifecyclePhase() has done

MarkDescendantEffectiveAllowedTouchActionChanged() on the IFRAME owner,

because layout_view->EffectiveAllowedTouchActionChanged() is true

(because a touch-action CSS property was changed).

LayoutObject::MarkDescendantEffectiveAllowedTouchActionChanged() usually

marks the ancestry, but in this case it doesn't, because of a display

lock.



Side note: I don't think it's necessary to add such objects to the list

of missable children in pre-paint. If we didn't, this bug wouldn't be

here. It should still be a safe thing to do, though.



To summarize, the fixed-positioned element was initially skipped during

pre-paint, because an ancestor bailed on Walk(). Then, upon closer

inspection, when trying to Walk() the descendant directly from

WalkMissedChildren(), we determine that it needs to be walked after all.

This seems inconsistent.



So maybe there are no legit use cases for this situation, but better fix

it anyway.



The DCHECK failure in PrePaintTreeWalk::GetOrCreateFragmentData() was

caused by the fact that we mistakenly entered fragment-accompanied

pre-paint walk without being inside a fragmentation context. The

fragmentainer index was thus not set, and GetOrCreateFragmentData() got

confused.



Bug: 1434550

Change-Id: I697619ebca6e169636c9cc0d05ef1b8aea68900b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4955942

Commit-Queue: Morten Stenshorne

Reviewed-by: Xianzhu Wang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1212910}

entry.title: Enable Intersection Observer Scroll Margin
entry.content:
This patch enables the IntersectionObserverScrollMargin flag by

default.



Intersection Observer scrollMargin allows developers to observe

targets inside nested scroll containers that are currently clipped

away by the scroll containers. This is achieved by expanding the

container's clipping rect by the scrollMargin when calculating the

intersection.



Spec:

https://www.w3.org/TR/intersection-observer/#dom-intersectionobserver-scrollmargin



Chrome Status:

https://chromestatus.com/feature/5091020593430528



Intent to Ship:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/Ax8rTBusZ4s/m/-yeyQlErAAAJ



R=pdr, chrishtr



Bug: 1469500

entry.title: Opacity animations clamp between [0,1] inclusive.
entry.content:
The current clamping behavior clamps the first float smaller than 1 and

was introduced by:



https://codereview.chromium.org/748823004/diff/180001/Source/core/animation/DoubleStyleInterpolation.cpp#newcode36



That points us to:



https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/WebKit/Source/core/css/resolver/AnimatedStyleBuilder.cpp;l=450;drc=dd429aa5f42b75a371377072ed6e1d06c07af231



So this was being used to induce a layer in the compositor. I suspect

this is no longer needed but causes issues since the clamp causes a

waiting animation to cause a style change which can cause unnecessary

animation updates as synthetic keyframes appear to change based on this

small clamping difference.



=== style-change-events.html ===



The clamping change was masking a failure of commitStyles in this

test (the test passes even if commitStyles is removed). Because the

animations created in the test were clamped, they created a transition

immediately. See the comment in the test's setup function:



// It's important to use opacity of '1' here otherwise we'll create a

// transition due to updating the specified style whereas the transition

// we want to detect is the one from flushing due to calling



This is exactly what the clamp does. The test fails now that we keep

opacity at 1 but there appears to be a real difference between Chrome

and Firefox here. See https://crbug.com/1493736



Change-Id: I98d74fecdb820f2e682435b7f83c4d6d11a9912e

Bug: 1445090,1493736

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4949332

Reviewed-by: Robert Flack

Commit-Queue: David Bokan

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1212878}

entry.title: [Price tracking] Prevent bad data access with absl::optional
entry.content:
It's possible for the price tracking handler for the UI to get into a

bad state with the absl::optional it uses for the pending tracking

state. Since the call to update subscriptions is async, If the user

interacts with the UI or otherwise does something that resets the

pending state prior to the first call coming back, we'll try to access

the value when there isn't on, causing a crash. This patch removes the

use of the optional in this case and instead passes the "pending state"

as a param to the callback, making this crash impossible and the state

always correct in the future.



Bug: 1494183

Change-Id: Ia0507262a330f1a70beca0f30dedc014c29eeacf

entry.title: Convert Repeat Properties to Longhands
entry.content:
Currently the `background-repeat` and `-webkit-mask-repeat` properties

are defined as shorthands which use `background-repeat-x/y` and

`-webkit-mask-repeat-x/y` respectively asÂ their composing longhands.



Since this is not defined in the specs, this CL converts the repeat

properties to longhands, removing the `*-repeat-x/y` non standard

longhands. This aligns Chrome's behavior with Safari (which removed

this 'hack' last year) and Firefox. As well this CL enables

`-webkit-mask-repeat` unprefixing as a followÂ up CL.



Spec links:

https://drafts.csswg.org/css-backgrounds-3/#background-repeat

https://drafts.fxtf.org/css-masking/#the-mask-repeat



R=andruud, pdr, chrishtr



Bug: 1418401, 1493690

Low-Coverage-Reason: TRIVIAL_CHANGE

entry.title: [A11y] When marking entire document dirty, don't repair parents
entry.content:
This fixes a crash that can occur when marking a document dirty.



Description of crash:

MarkDocumentDirtyWithCleanLayout() iterates all nodes and

calls SetNeedsToUpdateChildren(). This performs additional work

to ensure that each node, all the way to the root, has a

"has dirty descendants" flag set, and walks the parent chain,

repairing missing parents if necessary. This extra loop is unnecessary

because each node in the tree will already be visited by

MarkDocumentDirtyWithCleanLayout(). The code path gets out of

control because the calls to RepairMissingParent() end up creating

objects as we are marking them all dirty, as well as updating

cached values on objects (this was not expected to occur until

UpdateTreeIfNeeded()). Finally, children changed events are fired

because of the newly created objects. All of these unexpected

occurrences result in methods being called on detached objects where

that is not expected.



Description of fix:

Avoid walking parent chains while marking the document dirty.

This fix may also be ported to later branches, however, these specific crashes have not been seen there yet. Either way, it is an improvement

to avoid the unnecessary parent chain loops while visiting each node.



Bug: 1480675, b/305236511, b/305967411, 1493459, 1475004

Change-Id: Ifc1c803962bfcb98e49a986793d50470754a3580

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4950098

entry.title: [omnibox][webui] Keep popup width correct by handling LBV bounds changed
entry.content:
This CL makes OmniboxPopupPresenter an observer of LocationBarView so

that LBV bounds changes result in widget bounds updates. This fixes the

long-existing problem of stale popup width after window size changes.

> - kGaiaLogin: Login using Gaia like production chrome.

entry.title: Refactor WebXR Graphics Delegates classes
entry.content:
While working to implement the Cardboard Overlay, I've hit some road

blocks to just re-using the existing GraphicsDelegateWin; most likely

because we do not use command-buffer based gl on Android. Ultimately

it seems that we'll need to implement a new GraphicsDelegateAndroid to

implement the Overlay for both Cardboard and OpenXR. Further, some of

the methods in GraphicsDelegateWin weren't actually used the way that

they claimed to be anymore. Mainly that everything was called from the

same thread and thus initialization no longer needed to be split up.



The following refactors were made to enable eventually implementing a

GraphicsDelegateCardboard:



1) Simplify interface of GraphicsDelegateWin

2) Move methods that VrBrowserRendererThreadWin calls into

GraphicsDelegate to facilitate creation of a GraphicsDelegateAndroid

3) Collapse BaseGraphicsDelegate into it's only remaining child

(the GvrGraphicsDelegate)

- GVR is deprecated and will be removed soon and this allowed

explicit logic around the NOTREACHED methods to be better

documented



Bug: 1429376

Change-Id: Id1f988a6c8869dbf563b2569cafb435fe9c92d3f
